get.description: Retrieve OpenAPI specification in JSON format for API documentation.

post.description: Execute given code in the specified language using Piston API

language.description: The programming language to use for execution.
The name of the language used.

version.description: The version of the language used.

stdout.description: Standard output of the run stage

stderr.description: Standard error output of the run stage

output.description: Combined stdout and stderr output of the run stage

code.description: Exit code of the run process. Null if signal is not null.

signal.description: Signal from the run process. Null if code is not null.

compile.description: Results from the compile stage (if applicable)

stdout.description: Standard output of the compile stage

stderr.description: Standard error output of the compile stage

output.description: Combined stdout and stderr output of the compile stage

code.description: Exit code of the compile process. Null if signal is not null.

signal.description: Signal from the compile process. Null if code is not null.

get.description: Gets a list of the last 10 submissions for a question you've made for a specific question.

parameters.name: questionId
parameters.description: The ID of the question to submit.

creator_id.description: The ID of the user who created the submission.

code.description: The code submitted by the user.

passed.description: Whether the code passed the test cases.

submissions.description: The list of submissions made by the user.

400.description: Invalid request or missing path parameter.

get.summary: Retrieve question data for a specific question ID.
get.description: Retrives all the information for the specified question

parameters.name: questionId
parameters.description: The ID of the question to retrieve.

description.description: The full description for the question.

language.description: The language the code is written in.

items.description: Lines of code that define the "input" section of a code challenge.
Lines of code that define the "template" section of a code challenge. This is the code that the user will modify.
Lines of code that define the "solution" section of a code challenge. This is the correct answer.
Lines of code that define the "tester" section of a code challenge. This is the code that will test the user's solution and compare with the solution.

ANSWER.description: The expected output of the test case.

key.description: Other key-value pairs exist, where the key can be any string. The value associated with these other keys are also strings.

difficulty_sum.description: The sum of the difficulty ratings of the question.

difficulty_votes.description: The amount of difficulty ratings given to the question.

difficulty.description: The average difficulty rating of the question.

votes_bad.description: The downvotes given to the question.

votes_good.description: The upvotes given to the question.

votes_sum.description: The total votes given to the question.

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the question.

author_name.description: The name of the author of the question.

languages.description: The available coding languages for the question.

seconds.description: The number of seconds since the epoch.

nanoseconds.description: The number of nanoseconds since the epoch.

seconds.description: The number of seconds since the epoch.

nanoseconds.description: The number of nanoseconds since the epoch.

400.description: Question ID is not present or field is not valid.

post.description: Submits a coding question and returns the result.

parameters.name: questionId
parameters.description: The ID of the question to submit.

language.description: The language the code is written in.

code.description: The code submitted by the user.

redirect_to.description: The URL to redirect to after submission.

400.description: Invalid request or missing required fields.

post.description: Adds a new coding question to the database.

description.description: The full description for the question.

tags.description: Array of tags (must be valid tags from a predefined list).

display_publicly.description: Whether the question is publicly visible.

language.description: The programming language of the code snippet.

inputs.description: Array of input lines for the coding challenge.

template.description: Array of template lines for the coding challenge.

solution.description: Array of solution lines for the coding challenge.

tester.description: Array of tester lines for the coding challenge.

ANSWER.description: The expected output of the test case.

key.description: Key-value pairs representing inputs and expected outputs.

questionId.description: The ID of the newly created question.

400.description: Invalid request body or missing required fields.

post.description: Query a list of questions from the database given some query parameters

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (Required) The maximum number of questions to return. Must be between 1-20

parameters.name: filter_tag
parameters.description: (Optional) The field to order by. Can be "", "difficulty", "votes", "updated", or "created". Empty string will default to "votes".

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: (Optional) The field to order by. All orderings happen in descending order. Can be "", "difficulty", "votes", "updated", or "created"

parameters.name: start_after
parameters.description: (Optional) The question ID to start after. Can be empty for none. Cannot have both start_after and start_at

parameters.name: start_at
parameters.description: (Optional) The question ID to start at. Can be empty for none. Cannot have both start_after and start_at

parameters.name: difficulty
parameters.description: (Optional) The difficulty to filter by. Can be "easy", "medium", "hard". Easy is 0.0-3.2, medium is 3.3-6.6, hard is 6.7-10.0

parameters.name: difficulty_range
parameters.description: (Optional) The difficulty range to filter by. Can be a string of the format "0.0-10.0", range is inclusive, and must be between 0.0-10.0. Only gets checked if "difficulty" is empty

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: (Optional) The ID of the author to filter by. Trumps all tags besides limit. This will only return the public questions of the author, with no other ordering or filtering.

200.description: Returns a list of question metadata objects that match the query

difficulty_sum.description: The sum of the difficulty ratings of the question.

difficulty_votes.description: The amount of difficulty ratings given to the question.

difficulty.description: The average difficulty rating of the question.

votes_bad.description: The downvotes given to the question.

votes_good.description: The upvotes given to the question.

votes_sum.description: The total votes given to the question.

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the question.

author_name.description: The name of the author of the question.

languages.description: The available coding languages for the question.

seconds.description: The number of seconds since the epoch.

nanoseconds.description: The number of nanoseconds since the epoch.

seconds.description: The number of seconds since the epoch.

nanoseconds.description: The number of nanoseconds since the epoch.

400.description: Limit field is not present or field is not valid.

get.summary: Retrieve user data for a specific user ID.
get.description:
# When the request is coming from an authorized client:

**1. If the user doesn't exist in our database, but that user is requesting their data**
- We create an account for them, return their data after finished

**2. If the user doesn't exist in our database, and the requester is not the person whose data they want**
- Return 404. The user does not exist

**3. If the user exists in the database and the requester is that user**
- Return to them all of their data

**4. If the user exists in the database, but the requester is not that user**
- Send them only public data of the user

# When the request is coming from an unauthorized client:

**1. If the user doesn't exist in our database**
- Return 404. The user does not exist

**2. If the user does exist in our database**
- Send them only public data of the user

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user to retrieve.

github_id.description: The user's github id. Always included.

display_name.description: The user's display name. Always included.

avatar.description: The user's avatar URL (github url). Always included.

accepted.description: The list of challenges the user has completed.

created.description: The list of challenges the user has created.

points_accumulated.description: The user's total points (calculated by the sum of the difficulty rating of all accepted challenges)

get.summary: Retrieve the top 10 users sorted by points.
get.description: Retrieve the top 10 users sorted by points. Ignores everyone who has their points set to public.

github_id.description: The user's github id. Always included.

display_name.description: The user's display name. Always included.

avatar.description: The user's avatar URL (github url). Always included.

points_accumulated.description: The user's total points (calculated by the sum of the difficulty rating of all accepted challenges)

400.description: There was an error retrieving the leaderboard.
